questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14493

Natalie: Good morning, sir. My name is Natalie Sandlers. I am a new student in grade 10.  I would like to register for the Destination Imagination Club. May I get some information about the club, please?

Secretary: Certainly. First of all, in this club students work on a task in groups of seven. Each group chooses a challenge and works on it. They try to find creative solutions to the problem with limited material, in a limited period of time.

Natalie: How should we work to develop a solution?

Secretary: You should debate in your group to make an action plan and develop a scenario. The club aims to foster curiosity and creativity.

Natalie: What kind of methods do the groups use while working on the task?

Secretary: They should focus on drama, design and science.

Natalie: Are there any competitions during the year?

Secretary: Of course. The groups have to present their tasks at the end of each work. The best solutions to the problem go to the city finals.

Natalie: Thanks for the information. I would like to participate in this club.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Soru 1: 14465

We are dark-skinned people with short curly hair. We are generally short but strong people. Our women wear “sarong”. It is a traditional clothing. Our men also wear some kind of special clothes. They are made of leather of wild animals. We live on agriculture and preying. We don’t use any modern machines in agriculture. We use shovel, pickaxe, pitchfork and harrow. We are not nomadic people anymore. We have small shelters of wood and straw. We often go on trips into the forest for some days. This has both economical and spiritual value for us. We hunt animals, pick up some natural fruits and visit some religious caves and trees. We sell rattan, tree resins and honey. We buy clothes and other stuff. Now, we are about 300-500 people left in our tribe. But we live happily here in the nature because there’s no global warming or other problems of the modern world.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Clerk         Well, we have to fill in a form, first. What’s your first name, please?

Vanessa   It’s Vanessa.

Clerk         Oh, I’m sorry. I couldn’t understand. Could you spell it?

Vanessa   V-A-N-E-S-S-A.

Clerk         OK. Thank you. What is your family name?

Vanessa   It’s Silva.

Clerk        How old are you?

Vanessa   I’m thirty-two.

Clerk        What is your nationality?

Vanessa   Irish. I’m Irish.

Clerk         OK. And are you married?

Vanessa   No, I’m single.

Clerk        OK. What do you do?

Vanessa   I’m a banker.

Clerk        Thank you. And lastly, what’s your address?

Vanessa   It’s 23rd Street, Chicago.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14493

Natalie: Good morning, sir. My name is Natalie Sandlers. I am a new student in grade 10.  I would like to register for the Destination Imagination Club. May I get some information about the club, please?

Secretary: Certainly. First of all, in this club students work on a task in groups of seven. Each group chooses a challenge and works on it. They try to find creative solutions to the problem with limited material, in a limited period of time.

Natalie: How should we work to develop a solution?

Secretary: You should debate in your group to make an action plan and develop a scenario. The club aims to foster curiosity and creativity.

Natalie: What kind of methods do the groups use while working on the task?

Secretary: They should focus on drama, design and science.

Natalie: Are there any competitions during the year?

Secretary: Of course. The groups have to present their tasks at the end of each work. The best solutions to the problem go to the city finals.

Natalie: Thanks for the information. I would like to participate in this club.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14509

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

December, 6th 

Thanks to Birmingham's time management techniques course, I now have more realistic goals and know how to use time effectively. So, I believe I will be less busy and less stressed but more productive and more organized. I have a recipe for success. Here are my decisions for a new start:

Mon: I am going to list my tasks in order of importance. Then, I am going to start keeping a to-do list with deadlines.

Tue: I am going to clean my room and tidy my desk. I am going to remove the games on my smartphone. I am going to try to say 'no' to all-time wasters.

Wed: I am going to make a timetable and plan regular breaks to refresh my mind.

Thu: I am going to read books to learn from mistakes and to think positively. I am not going to take a negative attitude towards failure anymore.

Fri: I am going to work out in a gym near my house at 3 p.m. on Fridays.

Sat & Sun: A refreshing weekend with my books and friends...

What is the best option for Adam to be successful?

A) to refresh his mind
B) to plan his time
C) to learn from mistakes
D) to tidy the study area
E) to say 'no' to all time-wasters
A B C D E

Here are my decisions for a new start: Mon: I am going to list my tasks in order of importance. Then, I am going to start keeping a to-do list with deadlines. Tue: I am going to clean my room and tidy my desk. I am going to remove the games on my smartphone. I am going to try to say 'no' to all-time wasters. I am not going to take a negative attitude towards failure anymore. Fri: I am going to work out in a gym near my house at 3 p.m. on Fridays. A) to refresh his mind B) to plan his time C) to learn from mistakes D) to tidy the study area E) to say 'no' to all time-wasters A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14512

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Gizem, Huseyin and Ali are English teachers from different cities, but they are going to meet in İstanbul for a seminar on 10th October. Gizem and Hüseyin are going to take the bus to İstanbul, but Ali is going to take the train. They are going to stay at a 5-star hotel in Harbiye for 5 days. It will be a different experience for them because they are going to prepare questions for the students countrywide. They are going to work from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Every day after work, they are planning to do different activities in İstanbul. For example, Ali and Huseyin are going to go to a football match in Dolmabahce on Wednesday. Gizem has a different plan for the same day. She is going to meet some of her friends from university. They are planning to see the perfect view of İstanbul from the Sapphire Tower. She meets her old friends whenever she comes to İstanbul. Huseyin wants to take a city tour on Thursday. Ali is going to visit the Topkapi Palace and take some photos. On Friday evening, they are going to take a boat tour altogether. 15th October is their last day in İstanbul. They are going to finish work and leave the hotel at noon. They are looking forward to working together and having a wonderful time in İstanbul, the city of dreams.

Which of the following is the best title for the paragraph?

A) An Amazing Holiday
B) Work Work Work!
C) Istanbul 'The City of Dreams'
D) A Busy Week in Istanbul
E) Winter in Istanbul
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14519

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Dear Martin,

I am here in Madrid. I am very excited because I am starting my new job on Monday. My boss has already given me a monthly plan. I am going to search about the disease in some African countries with a group of people. We are going to set off tomorrow morning. The first destination is the Gambia. A guide is going to meet us at the airport. After staying 6 days there, we are going to fly to Togo. Nobody is going to meet us there. Ten days later we are going to leave for the last country, Nigeria. I hope to find useful things for humans.

Best regards

Vicky

We understand from the text that ...... 

A) Vicky is going to earn a lot of money from this job.
B) Vicky is going to visit three countries for this research.
C) Vicky is going to stay longer in Togo than Nigeria.
D) Vicky's boss is not a kind man.
E) somebody is going to meet Vicky and his friends in Nigeria.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14554

I have been on the roads on my motorbike for many years. No matter if you are an experienced or an inexperienced motorbike rider, you must plan your journey wisely before you hit the road. That’s what I do. Next month I am going to do a South Africa trip on my bike. For a safe and enjoyable trip, I am going to start with preparing a to do list like I always do.

Collecting Information: Prepare an initial draft of the route. Learn weather conditions for a safe ride. Prepare the luggage and plan the riding and resting time depending on the weather conditions. Search for the experiences of other riders. Get information about the main sights and attractions to see on the route. This will help you to discover new places.

Planning the time: Calculate how many days the trip will take. In order not to get too tired, don’t ride too long. Plan the riding and spare time on the trip considering the places on the road. During the breaks fill up the gasoline, eat and have a rest. Don’t forget to enjoy the scenery.

Calculating the budget:  While preparing the budget, take gasoline, accommodation, travel insurance, food, attractions and admission fees into account. Have enough cash for unplanned expenses.

Checking the plans: Review your plan. Be flexible and ready for the unexpected situations. Add or remove sights and attractions according to your mood, needs and budget.

Doing a motorcycle trip is all about enjoying the process, not arriving at the destination. When you look back at the warm memories of your journey, you will be delighted once more.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

I was on my way home from a visit to my daughters in Texas when I heard on the radio that Hurricane Katrina was about to hit Mississippi and Louisiana. When I got home, I checked the Internet to get specific information. I learned that Hurricane Katrina would hit on Monday morning, August 29th, 2005. By Monday at 6.30 a.m., Hurricane Katrina hit. There was a terrible storm. All the phone lines went dead. Nearly 3,000 people, including me, had to go to the hospital because of injuries by Katrina on that day. The first floor of the hospital started flooding. The power went off. We couldn't drink the water because it was poisonous. All of a sudden, water came into the room through the windows. There were bad injuries as the windows were broken, and the furniture crashed into people. Outside the hospital was also terrible. All the power lines and trees were down. The trees blocked the highways. Nobody was able to pass the roads. Everybody was really terrified. I had to stay in hospital till the following Monday. It was the most terrifying week of my life.

The reason why they couldn't drink water after the hurricane was that ...... .

A) they weren't thirsty
B) the water was poisonous
C) the water wasn't tasty
D) they were hungry
E) the weather was very cold
A B C D E

Hi Tracey,

I am back from a long journey on two continents. They are Europe and America. I went on this journey to see the world's 5 greenest countries. The journey was amazing. Big Hugs

John

A B C D E

In 1970, at 3.23 p.m., while many of the residents of Yungay were listening to the last minutes of the World Cup Soccer Game, the Ancash region and half of Peru were struck by a huge earthquake. It was the Ancash earthquake (also called the Great Peruvian earthquake), and the areas around Peru were also seriously affected. Besides, the earthquake triggered one of the most devastating avalanches in the past. Nearly 20,000 people were killed because of the avalanche, and a reporter said, "Yungay no longer exists, only 92 people survived''.

The avalanche ...... .

A) caused the Great Peruvian earthquake
B) was one of the reasons for the death of more than 20,000 people
C) occurred at 3:23 p.m.
D) was triggered by the earthquake
E) hit half of Peru
A B C D E

Bill: When I was a child, my grandfather used to tell me wonderful stories. I wish I could remember them.  If I remember them, I will tell them to my children.

Alice: Yes, dear. Unfortunately, you can’t. I remember when you told me the story about the lion that wants to be a human. You confused the whole story.

Bill: Oh, yes! It was one of the hardest stories, and my memory is weak. When a story is full of adventures like that one, I can never be sure what happened first.

Alice: Maybe, it would be better to read stories to the kids from storybooks.

It’s understood from the dialogue that ......

A) Alice likes listening to stories that Bill tells her.
B) Bill wants to read good stories to his grandchildren.
C) Bill's grandfather wasn’t the best storyteller in the family.
D) Bill is having trouble remembering the chronological order of the events in stories.
E) Alice is trying to be a good friend and not hurt Bill’s feelings about his grandfather.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14613

Architect Great Sinan

Sinan was one of the greatest Ottoman architects of the Ottoman Empire’s architectural heritage. It is generally assumed that he was born in 1490. He is an architect also known all around the world.  There are many architectures belonging to him and Şemsi Pasha Mosque is one of his gigantic and gorgeous architectures. The Şemsi Pasha Mosque is also known as Kuşkonmaz Mosque. It is an Ottoman Mosque located in the large and densely populated district of Üsküdar, in İstanbul, Turkey. What makes it different from other mosques is its incredible project.There is a reason why it is called Kuşkonmaz Mosque.The Şemsi Pasha, who lived in 1500s, was very meticulous and he was in competition with grand vizier Sokullu Mehmet Pasha. From time to time, when they came together, they criticized each other harshly. During the conversation about this mosque, built as a miniature of the Edirne Selimiye Mosque, Şemsi Pasha asked Sokullu: “Precious, the mosque made by you was very nice but the pigeons dirtied it.” Sokullu replied: Precious, they are the God’s creatures. It is normal and you cannot prevent it.” The conversation ended. One day, Şemsi Pasha also wanted to build a mosque. Suddenly, he remembered the conversation with Sokullu Pasha about his mosque. He said “Oh, no! What should I do? I said something without thinking and now I am in the same situation. However, it is Sinan who can solve the problem." Şemsi Pasha explained the situation to Sinan and asked: “Precious, is there a place where birds do not fly over?” Sinan replied cleverly: “Yes, there is a place like that.” After a short research, he found a place where the wind from north and south intersected in Üsküdar. And for a while, he examined the vibrations of waves that hit the shore. He thought that birds would be disturbed by the noise of the vibrations coming from the north and the south and then he determined the right place. "Here we can build the mosque" he said, and decided to do it at that place. This is where the "Şemsi Pasha Mosque" is located on the edge of the Bosphorus, sometimes cool, sometimes warm, but always windy, sometimes swirling the walls of angry waves. That's how it happens. It is one of landmarks of Üsküdar, "The story of the Kuşkonmaz Mosque”. The mosque was opened in 1580. It has been serving in as a place of worship and there have not been any birds in the garden since then.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14613

Architect Great Sinan

Sinan was one of the greatest Ottoman architects of the Ottoman Empire’s architectural heritage. It is generally assumed that he was born in 1490. He is an architect also known all around the world.  There are many architectures belonging to him and Şemsi Pasha Mosque is one of his gigantic and gorgeous architectures. The Şemsi Pasha Mosque is also known as Kuşkonmaz Mosque. It is an Ottoman Mosque located in the large and densely populated district of Üsküdar, in İstanbul, Turkey. What makes it different from other mosques is its incredible project.There is a reason why it is called Kuşkonmaz Mosque.The Şemsi Pasha, who lived in 1500s, was very meticulous and he was in competition with grand vizier Sokullu Mehmet Pasha. From time to time, when they came together, they criticized each other harshly. During the conversation about this mosque, built as a miniature of the Edirne Selimiye Mosque, Şemsi Pasha asked Sokullu: “Precious, the mosque made by you was very nice but the pigeons dirtied it.” Sokullu replied: Precious, they are the God’s creatures. It is normal and you cannot prevent it.” The conversation ended. One day, Şemsi Pasha also wanted to build a mosque. Suddenly, he remembered the conversation with Sokullu Pasha about his mosque. He said “Oh, no! What should I do? I said something without thinking and now I am in the same situation. However, it is Sinan who can solve the problem." Şemsi Pasha explained the situation to Sinan and asked: “Precious, is there a place where birds do not fly over?” Sinan replied cleverly: “Yes, there is a place like that.” After a short research, he found a place where the wind from north and south intersected in Üsküdar. And for a while, he examined the vibrations of waves that hit the shore. He thought that birds would be disturbed by the noise of the vibrations coming from the north and the south and then he determined the right place. "Here we can build the mosque" he said, and decided to do it at that place. This is where the "Şemsi Pasha Mosque" is located on the edge of the Bosphorus, sometimes cool, sometimes warm, but always windy, sometimes swirling the walls of angry waves. That's how it happens. It is one of landmarks of Üsküdar, "The story of the Kuşkonmaz Mosque”. The mosque was opened in 1580. It has been serving in as a place of worship and there have not been any birds in the garden since then.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14635

Stephen Hawking, one of the well-known physicists was born in Oxford on January 8, 1942. His parents were both academics who graduated from Oxford University. Education was so important for his family that reading books even during dinner times was their favourite activity. He was such a successful student at school that he was nicknamed as Einstein. Hawking built a computer from recycled materials with his Maths teacher and friends at high school. He entered Oxford University like his parents and continued his education at Cambridge. At the age of 21, he was diagnosed with ALS, a motor neuron disease. Doctors told him that he had two years to live without knowing that he had 55 more years. His illness left him paralyzed but fortunately his brain wasn’t affected. In 1985, he was hospitalized with pneumonia that caused a damage to his vocal cords. During the rest of his life, he had to communicate with the help of an electronic speech synthesizer. He combined the theory of relativity with quantum theory. In 1988, he published his book, “A Brief History of Time: From the Bing Bang to Black Holes. Although it was a science book, it became very popular and was sold more than 11 million copies. In spite of his desperate disease, he continued his studies until his death in 2018.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Selimiye Mosque in Edirne is one of the magnificent works of Mimar Sinan. An upside-down tulip under one of the marble legs of the muezzin’s stand is as famous as the mosque itself. According to the legend, when Sultan Selim II commissioned Sinan to build a mosque in Edirne, he desired a work of perfection to show Ottoman power.

The land which Sinan selected for the mosque belonged to an old lady. The lady was planting tulips of all kinds on this land. She was so stubborn that the great architect couldn’t persuade her to sell her garden. After a long struggle, the lady agreed to give the land, but she wanted Sinan to build a monument that would represent the owner. Architect Sinan decorated the mosque using 101 tiles of tulips with one inverted. While using the tiles of tulips, he kept his promise to the lady. He wanted to show how stubborn the lady was using a tile with this upside-down tulip.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

She was so stubborn that the great architect couldn’t persuade her to sell her garden. After a long struggle, the lady agreed to give the land, but she wanted Sinan to build a monument that would represent the owner. Architect Sinan decorated the mosque using 101 tiles of tulips with one inverted. While using the tiles of tulips, he kept his promise to the lady. He wanted to show how stubborn the lady was using a tile with this upside-down tulip. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

E) what used to be the most uncomfortable fashion in history

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14665

Chinese Great Wall

The purpose of the wall is to protect the boundaries of twenty separate Chinese dynasties. This wall is a small defense set. It was later completed by Qin Shi Huang, the first Chinese ruler, as a completely impenetrable wall. Thus, the attack of the Mongol and Turkish sides coming from the north to Qin Shi Huang's country will be eliminated. Many historians have different views on the construction of the defense wall, but the common view is that the war dynasties of neighboring dynasties captured during the war use it. And the government must be ruled by this defense wall from all sides of the world. It is also seen as a defense wall in the history of the Great Wall of China. The reason for this is that there are archery places, trenches and watchtowers every 200 meters on the wall. Not all of the Chinese Great Wall has a great example of workmanship and robustness. On the contrary, some of the walls were built with brick, while others were built with light building materials. It is usually built as 4-6 meters in height, 7 meters in base thickness and 6 meters in ceiling thickness, that is, the upper part of the wall.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Which of the following is not stated in the dialogue?

Diana: Our presentation is about the pros and cons of traditional roles in the family. I’ll talk about the pros, and Jason will talk about the cons. So, on the positive side, the roles are very clearly defined; both the man and woman know who does what. So, there is less confusion. The woman has time to manage things about the household chores while the man earns money to support the family.  Over to you, Jason.

Jason: Thank you, Diana. So, on the negative side, if the man is always the one who works, there can be little contact between the father and the children. Also, in some couples, the woman is good at tasks traditionally done by men, or vice-versa. I mean a woman might be better at fixing a car whereas a man might be better at cooking. Finally, and probably most importantly, women want to work and make a career, both for satisfaction and independence, and also to be role models for their children.

A) In some cases, couples can change their roles.
B) To avoid confusion, it is good to define the roles.
C) Spouses should share household chores equally.
D) In traditional families, all members depend on the father for financial support.
E) The teens are talking about the advantages and disadvantages of traditional roles in a family.
A B C D E

I have seen the film and the musical several times, and I’m always in floods of tears by the end because it’s so tragic and moving. It’s based on the book by the French writer Victor Hugo. It is set in France at the beginning of the 19th century, and it concerns the situation of the poor, and particularly the way the criminal justice system treats them.

A) The story is quite uplifting.
B) It’s not stated whether Harry read the book or not.
C) The story takes place in the late 1800s.
D) The film Les Misérables makes Harry laugh out loud.
E) The book Les Misérables shows up the social events in nineteenth-century France.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14665

Chinese Great Wall

The purpose of the wall is to protect the boundaries of twenty separate Chinese dynasties. This wall is a small defense set. It was later completed by Qin Shi Huang, the first Chinese ruler, as a completely impenetrable wall. Thus, the attack of the Mongol and Turkish sides coming from the north to Qin Shi Huang's country will be eliminated. Many historians have different views on the construction of the defense wall, but the common view is that the war dynasties of neighboring dynasties captured during the war use it. And the government must be ruled by this defense wall from all sides of the world. It is also seen as a defense wall in the history of the Great Wall of China. The reason for this is that there are archery places, trenches and watchtowers every 200 meters on the wall. Not all of the Chinese Great Wall has a great example of workmanship and robustness. On the contrary, some of the walls were built with brick, while others were built with light building materials. It is usually built as 4-6 meters in height, 7 meters in base thickness and 6 meters in ceiling thickness, that is, the upper part of the wall.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14716

Last year, my wife and I had a thirteen day vacation starting from December 1st in South America and saw very interesting places . First, we visited Brazil . We spent two days in Rio de Janeiro. We left Rio de Janeiro on the third of December and traveled east to Lima, Peru. We went there by plane across the Amazon Rainforest. It was the most fantastic flight of my life. We had just a day in Lima. Next, we visited Bolivia after spending a day in Uruguay. We spent three days there before we went to Argentina. We saw the Iguazu Waterfalls. They consist of 275 individual falls, and they stretch inwidth for 2.7 kilometers. They are between Argentina and Brazil. The scenery was awesome. You should definitely experience it once in your life. After two days, we took a train to Chile. We traveled in the green and snowy mountains. We visited San Rafael National Park. San Rafael Glacier is a giant glacier. It’s accessible only by boat or plane, so we got on a plane from Santiago to go there. It was the first time I saw such an enormous ice field. It was the the thirteenth of December when we came back home.

2- December  3       ---------

3- December  4       ---------

4- December  5      ---------

5- December  8      ---------

6- December  10    ----------

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14728

Receptionist: Sunshine hotel, how can I help you?

Bernadette: Hello, I’d like to find out about your room rates in August, please.

R: One moment, please. I’ll put you through to reservations.

Receptionist 2: Reservation, can I help you?

B: Yes, can you give me information about room rates in August, please?

R2: Yes, sure, madam. Do you have exact dates in mind?

B: Yes, we’re planning to come up at the weekend of the 18th of August and stay for about a week. So, we are thinking of going back on Saturday the 25th or Sunday the 26th.

R2: I see, madam. We have various rooms available for that week. How many people is the reservation for?

B: Well, there’s myself, my husband and our two children. They’re 12 and 8.

R2: Well, there are different options. We can arrange a double room for you and your husband, and a room with two singles or twin beds for your children.

B: Is it possible to have a family room for all of us?

R2: Yes, that's a possibility. Just let me check dates for you. It is a very busy time of year, you know.

B: Yes, I'd appreciate that.

R2: Well, you are very lucky. We have a family room for that date.

B: Great. I'd like to book that room, please. How much does it cost?

R2: It’s two hundred and eighty dollars per night. Can I have your name, please?

B: Bernadette Stevens.

R2: Could you spell your last name, please?

B: Of course. S-T-E-V-E-N-S

R2: And can I have your phone number and email?

B: Yes, my cell phone number is 575 48 76, and my email is stevens@ mail.com.

R2: I need your credit card information to reserve the room for you. What kind of card is it?

B: Visa. The card number is 8556 6745 9754.

R2: Alright, Mrs. Stevens. I’ve made your reservation for the 18th of August for a family room. Your check-in is at 2 pm.

B: Thank you very much.

R2: My pleasure. Have a nice day.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Agent: Good evening, Sir. What can I do for you?

Daniel: I’d like to plan a group vacation for the next month. You organize (1) _______ tours, don’t you?

Agent: Certainly. What would you like to do on your vacation?

Daniel: We’d like to explore different (2) __________ and visit ancient sites and buildings. And we’d like to rest along with a beautiful (3) __________.

Agent: Thailand tour seems to be a good choice for you. It has been the favorite (4) _________ for tourists. It’s full of magnificent beaches and breathtaking sceneries. It has an interesting culture and glorious ancient places.

Daniel: It is like a perfect place for us, isn’t it?

Agent: When are you planning to travel?

Daniel: On the fifth of May, and we’d like to have an (5) __________ class flight.

Agent: You’re not traveling alone, are you?

Daniel: No, I’m not. We are three college friends.

Agent: We have an afternoon (6) ________ leaving at 12:30 and a night flight at 8:45.

Daniel: Night flight is good. You have a student (7) _________, don’t you?

Agent: That’s right. We have a 15% discount for students. The package includes the flight, hotel and excursion and the airport transfer. Would you like us to send the tickets to you by post or to collect them in (8) ________?

Daniel: I can take them on next Wednesday, can’t I?

Agent: Sure. We’ll keep them ready for you.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Mike: I’ve failed a math test once again.

Jimmy: Oh, no! I can help you if you want.

Mike: I’ve tried to study with my sister, but you see the result.

Jimmy: Then, you should study with a teacher.

Mike: You’re right. I must talk to my Maths teacher first.

What is Mike planning to do?

A) He is going to see the result first.
B) His sister is going to help him.
C) He is going to study with Jimmy.
D) He is going to ask his teacher for advice.
E) He is going to study alone.
A B C D E

Maria:   If I have  an intention to have a vacation, I prefer to be in nature and discover the fascinating wild life and the animals in their habitat. I am a bit scared of insects but I believe I can manage it. If that is not possible, I don’t want to travel long hours for a few days on the beach.
Duke :  For me, vacation means being together with my family. I would rather spend time with my children in the countryside and explore the nature  away from technology and the crowd of the city life. However, I don’t think I have to go to Africa to be in nature!
Sally : I am keen on water sports and if there is a holiday plan, I would like to travel to a place where I can swim or windsurf. If I have to choose the second option, it won’t be the vacation full of action in nature.

Read the brochure about holiday types and Maria, Duke and Sally’s ideas about holiday types. Then, complete the chart below about the best and worst holiday suggestions for them.

Name             Best Suggestion            Worst Suggestion               Reason

Maria

Duke

Sally

 

 

 

A) -
B) -

E) -
A B C D E

Agent: Good evening, Sir. What can I do for you?

Daniel: I’d like to plan a group vacation for the next month. You organize (1) _______ tours, don’t you?

Agent: Certainly. What would you like to do on your vacation?

Daniel: We’d like to explore different (2) __________ and visit ancient sites and buildings. And we’d like to rest along with a beautiful (3) __________.

Agent: Thailand tour seems to be a good choice for you. It has been the favorite (4) _________ for tourists. It’s full of magnificent beaches and breathtaking sceneries. It has an interesting culture and glorious ancient places.

Daniel: It is like a perfect place for us, isn’t it?

Agent: When are you planning to travel?

Daniel: On the fifth of May, and we’d like to have an (5) __________ class flight.

Agent: You’re not traveling alone, are you?

Daniel: No, I’m not. We are three college friends.

Agent: We have an afternoon (6) ________ leaving at 12:30 and a night flight at 8:45.

Daniel: Night flight is good. You have a student (7) _________, don’t you?

Agent: That’s right. We have a 15% discount for students. The package includes the flight, hotel and excursion and the airport transfer. Would you like us to send the tickets to you by post or to collect them in (8) ________?

Daniel: I can take them on next Wednesday, can’t I?

Agent: Sure. We’ll keep them ready for you.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14591

Answer the following question according to the e-mail.

Hi Tracey,

I am back from a long journey on two continents. They are Europe and America. I went on this journey to see the world's 5 greenest countries. The journey was amazing. I came back with lots of unforgettable memories and photos. Of course, everything was not perfect during the journey. I had some problems, as well. For example, I broke one of my toes while climbing a small mountain in Switzerland. It hurt a lot and no one was there to give me a hand. I felt desperate. After some time in the forest, I saw a beautiful hut. There was a married couple in it. They gave me a bed and took care of me for two days. When my toe was OK, I kept walking in the green mountains. Anyway, you are going to see all the photos soon.

Big Hugs

John

What do you advise John?

A) You shouldn't travel to too many continents.
B) You should take photos during your journey.
C) You shouldn't travel alone especially when you are in nature.
D) You shouldn't have unforgettable memories.
E) You shouldn't send me messages.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Read the text and find the main idea.

It is a fact that doing household chores is a vital part of life. Even if most people do not like them, they know that they must do them. In modern societies, there is close cooperation in the household chores in families. Therefore, everyone should do almost all the household chores. Especially, women expect their children and husband to contribute in some way to family life. Some children do household chores every day or week. Research studies also show that children become happier when they have the idea that they are an important part of their family. Everyone in the family should have tasks and they should see them as a responsibility, not as a trouble.

A) Only women are responsible for the household chores in a family.
B) In modern societies, children should not do household chores.
C) Everyone should be responsible for every household chore in a family.
D) Research studies show that children get sad when they do household chores.
E) Household chores should be seen as trouble because they are bad.
A B C D E

Mary: You look upset, Sally. What's the problem?

Sally: Nothing. I don't want to talk about it.

Mary: Come on! You can tell me, what's up?

Sally: Well, I've just got a message from Sandra. She wants me to take a photo of my chemistry exam paper tomorrow and send it to her. What (1)_______________ I do, Mary?

Mary: Well, whatever you do, you (2)_______________  cheat. That's for sure. They can expel you for that.

Sally: Right.

Mary: And I think you (3)_______________ tell your teacher.

Sally: What? I can't do that!

Mary: OK, but you (4)_______________  tell her what you think.

Sally: Are you sure?

Mary: Yes, definitely. Don't worry. I'm sure she'll understand.  

Sally: Yes, you're right. Thanks, Mary. 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Sam: Hello, Kate!

Kate: Hi, Sam! How are you settling in?

Sam: Oh, quite well, everybody’s very friendly and everything is fine but I’m a bit confused about the school uniform regulations, though.

Kate: Oh, anything I can help you with?

Sam: Well yes, the thing is, are we supposed to wear them all the time?

Kate: Yeah, unfortunately, they are too strict with this rule.

Sam: OK, I thought so. I just wanted to check. And one more thing, are we allowed to have long hair at school?

Kate: No, that’s a big no-no. The length of the hair should not be shorter than a “number 2” razor cut for boys. Hair should not be touching the shirt collar and should be off the face for girls.

Sam: Hmm but I saw Charlie wearing long hair yesterday and I thought…

Kate: No... it was his fault and the school principle warned him to have his hair cut.

Sam: Oh, right, I see. Thank you for your warning.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14798

Mr Somerset: Hi everyone. I am very glad to see you all again in my class. I hope we will enjoy the new school year together. I am sure none of you has forgotten the rules and regulations of our school however; I’d like to remind them once more. You all should have these responsibilities. You can read  all the rules and regulations on the notice board as well.  But first, I want to read them all.

You have to attend school regularly.

You must respect the educational rights of others.

You must respect your peers and teachers regardless of ethnicity, religion or gender.

You have to respect the property and equipment of the school and others.

You should carry out reasonable instructions to the best of your ability.

You should conduct yourselves in a courteous and appropriate manner in school and in public.

You must keep the school environment and the local community clean.

You have to observe the uniform code of the school.

You must read all school notices and bring them to their parents’ attention.

As you know, to have a problem-free school year, it is vital to obey the rules for all of us. Do not forget that, you are all expected to follow all the rules at all times when on the school grounds, representing the school, attending a school activity or when clearly associated with the school, for example when you’re wearing the school uniform.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Andrew    Is that all?

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14792

1

You should always keep in mind that the cost of energy you use in your homes can be a major expense. Moreover, much of the energy comes from a limited supply of fuel such as coal, oil and natural gas and they are all non-renewable. If you take some simple steps, you can make electricity and natural gas more affordable, conserve energy and promote cleaner energy solutions.

2

The first step is you should become energy conscious. Using energy wisely is being aware of how you use energy. If you know where and how you use energy, this will help you find ways to cut your costs and save energy.

3

The next step is you should be energy smart. There are plenty of low-cost steps to reduce your energy use. For example, you should raise your thermostat in the summer and lower it in the winter. Using your air conditioner less and changing filters regularly can be always a good idea. In addition to these, you should never forget to turn off the lights when not in use. Also, when buying appliances, choose models with the energy star label because they can save you up to 30% on your appliance energy costs.

4

The last step is you should understand environmental impacts of energy production. Fossil fuel sources, including coal, oil and natural gas can significantly impact the environment through air emissions. They all contribute to acid rain, global warming and smog. These emissions also affect our health and environmental quality. On the other hand, renewable energy resources including wind (from wind turbines), solar (from photovoltaics), and hydro (falling water from rivers and dams) have virtually no air emissions.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Today, especially in the villages, some traditional foods are made by housewives at homes. For example, baklava” is cooked not in the modern electrical ovens but in the traditional cooking stoves. The sweet and some gifts are shared among family members and close friends. People buy new clothes, shoes and accessories. When it is evening, the streets are full of people under a lot of lights and firework. We go out, walk in the streets, have dinner with our families, take photos play guitar, sing songs and have fun.

E) -

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14837

National Sovereignty and Children’s Day/ Festival:

Children’s Day is held on 23rd of April each year and is an official holiday. Most businesses are closed as well on that day. It is celebrated throughout the country and from all over the world with participation of children and adults. The purpose of the day is to celebrate and emphasize the importance of the first gathering of the Turkish Grand National Assembly (the Turkish Parliament). It was, then, seen as the first step to becoming an independent state in the form of a republic. Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the founder of Turkish Republic, dedicated the new republic to children. It is also an international day as children from different countries are invited and brought to Turkey to join the celebrations. Turkish school children symbolically take seats in the parliament and govern the country for one day. Among the most common activities of the festivals are laying wreaths, saying poems, performing national dances and sports competitions and races. It is the first and only international children’s day in the world.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14854

                                         The Fringe Festival
The Edinburgh Fringe Festival is the world's largest arts festival which takes place in Scotland's capital every August. Thousands of performers go on hundreds of stages all over the city to present shows of all kinds and for every taste. The participants range from huge names in the world of entertainment to unknown artists that want to build their careers.
The Fringe story began when eight uninvited theatre groups attended to Edinburgh International Festival in 1947. This organisation was created to celebrate the European cultural life after the Second World War. The performers just kept on staging their shows on the fringe of the festival, without caring that they weren’t listed in the official programme. Year after year, more and more performers followed their pioneers and in 1958, the Festival Fringe Society was created. Today, it encourages everyone that takes part in the festival. 
The Festival Fringe Society supports all the amazing artists, producers, media members with tailored advice, events and online resources. It assists the audiences who come to Edinburgh. It provides ticketing to every show on the Fringe, gives brief information via official Fringe Programme, website and mobile app.
Audiences enjoy theatre, comedy, dance, circus, cabaret, children's shows, physical theatre, musicals, opera, music, exhibitions and events. A totally open-access festival, the Fringe welcomes anyone with a story to tell, plays to perform and the audience to watch all the performances.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

The Festival Fringe Society supports all the amazing artists, producers, media members with tailored advice, events and online resources. It assists the audiences who come to Edinburgh. It provides ticketing to every show on the Fringe, gives brief information via official Fringe Programme, website and mobile app. Audiences enjoy theatre, comedy, dance, circus, cabaret, children's shows, physical theatre, musicals, opera, music, exhibitions and events. A totally open-access festival, the Fringe welcomes anyone with a story to tell, plays to perform and the audience to watch all the performances. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

Have you ever wondered how pasta, the most enjoyed food around the world, is made? Here it is.

Pasta is made from a mixture of water and semolina flour. Eggs are sometimes added to the mixture for color or richness. For some different flavorings vegetable juices are added here. The mixture is kneaded to a proper consistency. Then in a machine, it is pressed into sheets by large cylinders. Later the roll of dough moves through a steamer. And now, pasta is ready to go to the market!

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14837

National Sovereignty and Children’s Day/ Festival:

Children’s Day is held on 23rd of April each year and is an official holiday. Most businesses are closed as well on that day. It is celebrated throughout the country and from all over the world with participation of children and adults. The purpose of the day is to celebrate and emphasize the importance of the first gathering of the Turkish Grand National Assembly (the Turkish Parliament). It was, then, seen as the first step to becoming an independent state in the form of a republic. Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the founder of Turkish Republic, dedicated the new republic to children. It is also an international day as children from different countries are invited and brought to Turkey to join the celebrations. Turkish school children symbolically take seats in the parliament and govern the country for one day. Among the most common activities of the festivals are laying wreaths, saying poems, performing national dances and sports competitions and races. It is the first and only international children’s day in the world.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14856

                           A CHICKEN IN A DUCK IN A TURKEY
What is a Turducken? A Turducken is a turkey, stuffed with a duck, stuffed with a chicken. Turducken is a very popular dish in Louisiana, US. The name is a portmanteau of those ingredients, turkey, duck, and chicken. It’s one of the ten toughest recipes in the world. Preparation is the main key of the recipe. You also have to be careful that the chicken is cooked but the turkey is not dry.
First you have to rinse and bone the birds. Peel the meat from the bones and remove the bones. After boning, you are going to put the birds in a container with sugar, salt and 9.5 lt of water. Place the meat from the turkey, duck and chicken into the brine and refrigerate overnight. 
Meanwhile, you should make the stock. Put the carcasses, carrots, celery ribs, sage, rosemary, bay leaves, peppercorns, garlic cloves, halved onion and water into a very large pot. Boil all, then reduce to a simmer and simmer up to 6 hours (until bones are easily broken). Pour pot contents into a large container. Refrigerate stock overnight and in the morning, remove the solid fat layer.
Remove the meat from the refrigerator and bring to room temperature. Make the stuffing. Heat the butter and 2 cups of Turducken stock in saucepan until almost boiling. Mix it with bread cubes in mixing bowl. Allow to cool until it can be handled.
Lay the boneless turkey on a cutting board. Dust with pepper and garlic powder. Coat with a thick layer of stuffing. Dust with pepper and garlic powder. Coat with a thick layer of stuffing. Lay the boneless chicken on the stuffing layer, and coat again. Fold the chicken, fold the duck, and then fold the turkey so that the skin of the back comes together.
Close the birds in order, with the help of the skewers. Make sure the string is tight around the skewers. Place the Turducken in 500 degree oven and roast for 20 minutes. Finally, let the Turducken rest for 20 minutes. It’s ready to serve, bon apétit!

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Lay the boneless chicken on the stuffing layer, and coat again. Fold the chicken, fold the duck, and then fold the turkey so that the skin of the back comes together. “The Birth of “zay-tube”.

Danny Tech is the owner of “zay-tube”. Its motto was “broadcast your games”. When he built up his website, he was only 16. Once he was at a café with his best friends, Jenny and William. When he declared his idea about broadcasting the games on a website, they found it nonsense. But Danny didn’t give up his idea. He went back to his home. He made up his mind and his parents supported hım. Firstly, he found a name for his website. Then he made a plan and started building it up. But he had some financial problems. So, he sold his old toys on the internet and saved enough money for his plan. He spent only a month on his dream. Finally, he built up his game sharing tube. But at the beginning it wasn’t very popular. He had to advertise his website’s name to reach more and more people. He decided to sell his old mobile phone, tablet, walkman, CD player, and his old bicycle with the helmet. Finally, he got the enough money and introduced his website throughout the world. Almost all his sharers were from Far East and China. Nowadays it is one of the most popular game sites in the world. Within six months he earned 5 million dollars. Last week a big company offered him 100 million dollars to buy his website. But Danny refused them. Now his mottos in the life are  “ No pain, no gain” and “Stay strong, never back down” .

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14912

                           TECHNOLOGY, EVIL OR GOOD?
There is no doubt that we live in the age of technology. It is used by both individuals and businesses. It has become part of our lives, at least every one of us has to use it, either for communication, education, health purposes, travel or business. There has been much dispute on whether the effects of technology on society have been beneficial or not. Arguments continue on both sides, but in order to have a clear opinion, you have to hear them both out.
Due to technology, ways of producing goods has been greatly developed. As a result, this has caused a major reduce in waste, and lower costs for the consumers. If a worker is able to save ten minutes of time because of technology, that’s an extra ten minutes they can do something else. Thus, computers can work with greater efficiency when compared to how a person works. Since the business owners has discovered that they can do more with less, they do not need to hire labour or pay for marketing experts to sell their products. So, this situation left a lot of people jobless.
The children born in the 1980s or before, used to find information from the books in the library or by owning an encyclopaedia. Now, technology makes it easy to research, purchase, or discover what we want or need every day. Because of these developments in research, lack of privacy has increased. If you want to find out a lot of personal information about someone, the technology of the internet can serve your needs effectively and this is often misused.
These are only two examples of how technology affects our lives in good and bad ways. They show us that we can have a better life and be more productive if we are aware of the negatives and work to overcome them. There will always be a good side and a bad side of technology. It is up to us to find the good in it every day.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

A computer is a programmable machine which is designed to carry out a sequence of arithmetic or logical operations automatically. The first use of the word “computer” was in 1613, referring to a person who carried out calculations, or computations, and the word continued with the same meaning until the middle of the 20th century. From the end of the 19th century, the word began to take on its more familiar meaning: a machine which carries out computations. In the beginning, computers were as big as a large room. Later, they became smaller and accessible to anyone. Then we had personal computers. After that, developers created new applications to help users perform many things from word processing to image editing. Large scales of programs have opened new horizons in information technology. Now, computers have noticeable impact on social relations. They have created new forms of social interaction and activities. With the Internet, working with computers has become a part of our daily lives. In addition to face to face communication, a new form of virtual communication has become more predominant.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14887

“The Brick”

Today, we can’t live without our mobile phones, but in fact the history of the mobile phone is not so old. The first truly portable phone was made in 1983. It weighed 800 gr. It was 30 cm long and 4,5 cm wide. You got 30 minutes of talk-time and it took around 10 hours to charge. It had six hours standby. It could store 30 phone numbers. It cost $3995. That would be about $10000 today! It had a single-line LED screen. And only nine characters could fit in the screen. It had a 15 cm length antenna. It was nicknamed as “the brick” but it was a real success in the world of technology and it kicked off the mobile age.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14906

Silicon Valley is the home of the microelectronics industry in the U.S. It is located in Northern California, within the southern region of San Francisco. 
In the 1920s, a professor named Dr. Frederick Terman of Stanford University convinced the university to make cheap land available around Stanford to encourage students to start companies near the university. Stanford owned and still owns huge amounts of land in Santa Clara Valley.
The name Silicon Valley was made up in 1971 by Don C. Hoefler, the editor of the Microelectronics News, when he used this term in his magazine as the title for a series of articles about the technological industry in Santa Clara County. Silicon Valley was first given its name because of the many silicon chip creators and manufacturers were there.
Most of the largest technology companies in the world today are located within the SF Bay Area / Silicon Valley region. The revolutionary inventions and developments which have been made in this "Valley" affect everyone's daily life, and it is hard to imagine the modern civilization without them. 
“Silicon Valleys” are beginning to pop up all over the world and it is amazing. In LA (Silicon Beach), New York (Silicon Alley) and Austin, Boston, Seattle, Bangladore, ShenZhen, Tel Aviv and so many other places, technology corporations are working hard to make new inventions for humanity.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Stanford owned and still owns huge amounts of land in Santa Clara Valley. The name Silicon Valley was made up in 1971 by Don C. Hoefler, the editor of the Microelectronics News, when he used this term in his magazine as the title for a series of articles about the technological industry in Santa Clara County. Silicon Valley was first given its name because of the many silicon chip creators and manufacturers were there. Most of the largest technology companies in the world today are located within the SF Bay Area / Silicon Valley region. The revolutionary inventions and developments which have been made in this "Valley" affect everyone's daily life, and it is hard to imagine the modern civilization without them. “Silicon Valleys” are beginning to pop up all over the world and it is amazing. In LA (Silicon Beach), New York (Silicon Alley) and Austin, Boston, Seattle, Bangladore, ShenZhen, Tel Aviv and so many other places, technology corporations are working hard to make new inventions for humanity. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

I love big cities. As I was born in a big city and have never lived in somewhere else, I am a real city slicker. I can’t imagine living in anywhere except my city. If you live in a big city, it means you face with many but usual problems in your daily life. Pollution, traffic jam or violent crimes are the most common ones and almost everybody wants to find some solutions to these problems. If I had a chance, there are a few things I would change. Firstly, if I were the mayor, I would ban cars from the city centre to reduce the traffic jam. Secondly, there are a lot of litters in parks, streets and even in the city centre. If I were the authorized person to make the city cleaner, I would urge the people to sort their waste and dispose of it in the appropriate bins. Also, I would make it illegal to drop litter in the streets, parks or somewhere else. Finally, if I could make a difference, I would make the streets safer. I would encourage people to report about all the small crimes they saw. I think these precautions will improve life in my city.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Choose the correct option to complete the dialogue.

Jill: Hi, Wilma. Jill is speaking. How are you?

Wilma: Hi. Trying to be better.

Jill: What do you mean? What’s the matter?

Wilma: I haven’t been feeling well lately. I have severe aches on my back.

Jill: Oh, I’m really sorry. Have you seen the doctor?

Wilma: No, not yet.

Jill: If I were you, I would immediately call the doctor for an appointment.

Wilma: You are right. I must see a doctor. I thought my aches would stop after taking the pills, but nothing has changed.

B) I wish you ate healthy food.

D) I wish you were healthy and here with us.
E) I wish you drank at least 3 litres of water.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14960

Kevin:  I’m not really looking forward to studying for the final IT exam this summer, but unfortunately I have to do so. I wish I could travel instead. That’s what I did last summer: I travelled the costs of Greece for a month.

Jaden:  You have a point! You know I’m not a techno freak as well. Where would you like to go? Greece again? Or somewhere else..?

Kevin:   Not sure about the country. I only wish I had the money to go overseas again. In fact, I wish I could spend more than a month to travel abroad this year. For once, my aim is not to have a holiday but also to learn new cultures or participating in some voluntary projects.

            Jaden:  Do you mean an entire year?

Kevin:  Yeah, why not? How nice it would be. Don’t you wish you could do something   like that, too? I mean taking a break from school and doing something else?

Jaden:  No, not really. I’m happy studying here. But I wish I took more credits, so I could finish the school sooner. I need to start making some money.

Kevin:  That’s not me. 10 credits for each semester are enough for me but unfortunately; I spent my entire gap year on the Net last year. It took me a long time to figure out what I wanted to do. I regret starting college late. Maybe studying abroad would be better for me.

Jaden:  Oh, I’ve just remembered! I saw a poster around the school about studying abroad but I couldn’t remember where it was...I wish I remembered, where I saw it. You go overseas and study there to get your credit.

Kevin:    That sounds perfect! It may be a big chance for me. It would be perfect to receive credits for the time I spent in Greece.

Jaden:   Hey, I remember now . . . . I saw the poster on the wall near the library entrance. I think, you should take a test before applying. Why don’t you stop by and check it out?

Kevin:     I will. It sounds perfect for me. Thanks, Jaden.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

B) The Nobel Prize

D) A new technique, Maxicell
E) The Success Story of a Turkish Scientist

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Today, I got up at 6 as usual. It was a foggy morning, so I sipped my coffee enjoying the scenery outside the tent. I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. It was the third day of the excavation, and we did quite a lot today. We realised how tired we were when we sat for lunch. It wasn't a big lunch, just a piece of toast and coffee. In the afternoon, we continued our routine work; digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day, as it always is, so I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep. Bye for now!

According to the passage, the author .......

A) always gets up early
B) sometimes goes to bed late
C) never has breakfast
D) dislikes drinking coffee in the morning
E) is working in an office
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52744

Choose the correct statement to complete the sentence below according to the paragraph.

I am grateful to the English author Horace Walpole, my hero, for introducing the word serendipity to us. In one of his letters, which he had more than 3000, he stated “this discovery, indeed, is almost of that kind which I call serendipity, a very expressive word.” Like he said, the word itself came to him by serendipity. He formed the word on an old name for Sri Lanka, Serendip. Horace explained that this name was a part of the title of a Persian fairy tale, named The Three Princes of Serendip. While the three noblemen were travelling in the tale, they were always making discoveries by means of accidents and insight. They were not looking for these discoveries, actually. One of the most remarkable examples of this accidental wisdom was the discovery of the beggar boy who would be King Sharanan.

The narrator of the paragraph indicates that Horrace Walpole ...... .

A) searched for the word serendipity
B) was the man who formed the word serendipity
C) thought too much to form the word serendipity
D) discovered many new words in his numerous writings
E) was the author who wrote Persian history accidentally
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52746

Answer the questions according to the paragraph given below.

I am grateful to the English author Horace Walpole, my hero, for introducing the word serendipity to us. In one of his letters, which he had more than 3000, he stated “this discovery, indeed, is almost of that kind which I call serendipity, a very expressive word.” Like he said, the word itself came to him by serendipity. He formed the word on an old name for Sri Lanka, Serendip. Horace explained that this name was a part of the title of a Persian fairy tale, named The Three Princes of Serendip. While the three noblemen were travelling in the tale, they were always making discoveries by means of accidents and insight. They were not looking for these discoveries, actually. One of the most remarkable examples of this accidental wisdom was the discovery of the beggar boy who would be King Sharanan.

We can infer from the passage that the word Serendipity means ...... .

A) forming a new word accidentally
B) finding nonsense things accidentally
C) travels made for interesting discoveries
D) fairy tales teaching moral whenever you read
E) finding or discovering interesting or valuable things by chance
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

I love big cities. As I was born in a big city and have never lived in somewhere else, I am a real city slicker. I can’t imagine living in anywhere except my city. If you live in a big city, it means you face with many but usual problems in your daily life. Pollution, traffic jam or violent crimes are the most common ones and almost everybody wants to find some solutions to these problems. If I had a chance, there are a few things I would change. Firstly, if I were the mayor, I would ban cars from the city centre to reduce the traffic jam. Secondly, there are a lot of litters in parks, streets and even in the city centre. If I were the authorized person to make the city cleaner, I would urge the people to sort their waste and dispose of it in the appropriate bins. Also, I would make it illegal to drop litter in the streets, parks or somewhere else. Finally, if I could make a difference, I would make the streets safer. I would encourage people to report about all the small crimes they saw. I think these precautions will improve life in my city.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14994

A DIFFICULT SHOPPING

Sally: Debra, I need your help.

Debra: Oh, what happened? Of course, I will help if I can.

Sally: I’m very confused. I can’t decide which jacket I should buy.

Debra: Oh Sally, this is so easy. OK, let me see.

Sally: Here they are. I like both of them very much. They are so attractive and beautiful.

Debra: Sure they are. They look very impressive. What about their prices? Which one is more expensive? Did you ask their prices?

Sally: Yeah. The black one is $75 and the grey one is $80. They are nearly the same price.

Debra: OK. What about asking the shop assistant for help? Maybe, we can make our mind much more easily. Excuse me! Can you help us?

Shop Assistant: Yes, sure. How can I help you?

Debra: What are these jackets made of?

Shop Assistant: Let me see. The grey one is made of artificial leather and the black one is made of leather.

Debra: Oh, perfect, thank you. Emma, I think you should buy the black one. The leather ones are usually of higher quality than the artificial ones.

Sally: Well, I know that very well. However, I can’t make up my mind. Should I try them on again?

Shop Assistant: Of course, as you wish.

Sally: Look at them again, Debra! Which one looks more beautiful?

Debra: The black one looks great on you. It’s longer than the grey one. You are tall and thin, so it fits you great. Without any doubt, you should buy the black one.

Shop Assistant: The black one is also on sale. It costs $75 as I said before. I also advise you to buy it. You won’t be regretful.

Sally: OK. I have made up my mind. I will buy it. Thanks a lot.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14994

A DIFFICULT SHOPPING

Sally: Debra, I need your help.

Debra: Oh, what happened? Of course, I will help if I can.

Sally: I’m very confused. I can’t decide which jacket I should buy.

Debra: Oh Sally, this is so easy. OK, let me see.

Sally: Here they are. I like both of them very much. They are so attractive and beautiful.

Debra: Sure they are. They look very impressive. What about their prices? Which one is more expensive? Did you ask their prices?

Sally: Yeah. The black one is $75 and the grey one is $80. They are nearly the same price.

Debra: OK. What about asking the shop assistant for help? Maybe, we can make our mind much more easily. Excuse me! Can you help us?

Shop Assistant: Yes, sure. How can I help you?

Debra: What are these jackets made of?

Shop Assistant: Let me see. The grey one is made of artificial leather and the black one is made of leather.

Debra: Oh, perfect, thank you. Emma, I think you should buy the black one. The leather ones are usually of higher quality than the artificial ones.

Sally: Well, I know that very well. However, I can’t make up my mind. Should I try them on again?

Shop Assistant: Of course, as you wish.

Sally: Look at them again, Debra! Which one looks more beautiful?

Debra: The black one looks great on you. It’s longer than the grey one. You are tall and thin, so it fits you great. Without any doubt, you should buy the black one.

Shop Assistant: The black one is also on sale. It costs $75 as I said before. I also advise you to buy it. You won’t be regretful.

Sally: OK. I have made up my mind. I will buy it. Thanks a lot.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15005

                                               SHOP SMARTER
You are luckier than the other people if your clothing size doesn’t change much from year to year. Stocking up on clothing at the end of the season is a great way to save money,and to have a good supply of new clothing available for next year.This works better for many classic or staple items ,like suits, pants, jeans and cardigans that aren’t prone to going out of style too quickly. Trendy items may be a bit more risky as they tend to become passe after a season or two.
Keep in mind that the fashion seasons are more different than the seasons marked on your calendar. When it comes to fashion,the new season usually begins about two months earlier than the official change of season. Given this fact,if you wait until the end of the season,you should still be able to get something before having to pack it away for next year. In January or February,you can start looking for cold weather clothing. Jackets and winter accessories often start to go on sale around this time. August is when you are able to find bathing suits,summer clothes and sandals on sale as the summer starts to come to a close. Athletic footwear often goes on sale in January when people are thinking of New Year’s resolutions, though you’ll often find sneakers on sale again in April. Jeans go on sale in October after the back-to-school rush has subsided.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15014

The e-commerce era has already begun. It really doesn’t matter if you live in a remote village in South America, in Italy or in Turkey. You must have bought something online before. If you haven’t ,you will surely do it soon. The reality is that e-commerce is revolutionizing the way we shop. Can you guess someone who doesn’t want his shopping cart delivered on his doorstep? This simple logic makes e-commerce a huge success.

According to the latest statistics, over 62% of the consumer in USA now shop online at least once a week. The data also showed that 8 out of 10 online shoppers are very satisfied with their overall shopping experience. E-commerce is ,no doubt, growing very fast. It is breaking the traditional market. Nowadays, almost everything can be bought online such as food ,electronics ,clothes and even school utilities. E-commerce is a kind of shopping revolution. It is not only changing our habits towards buying, but it is also changing the way we sell. Most consumers will choose online store because of the convenience,time-saving factor,and even free delivery. They can shop online whatever they want, no matter where the product is produced.

At the moment, we only see the fast beginning of e-commerce. A lot is going to change in coming years. Some companies are already working on delivering products with drones and also getting your order into your room even when you are not at home. We are going to witness more changes to the way we shop in the coming years, thanks to e-commerce.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52755

Find the closest meaning to the underlined statement below.

Hello! I’m Celine from Canada. I’m a student at university. I enjoy shopping, but I don’t have much money to buy a coat in winter and to buy a t-shirt in summer because clothes are very expensive during the seasons. So, I generally buy most of my clothes during out-of-season sales. I advise everyone to do that. But, when I am shopping till the sunset, it’s tiring as I generally shop till I drop. However, it’s great when I take the best advantage of discounts. Last week, I bought a laptop, but unfortunately the second-hand laptop I bought last month is a real lemon. Because, it’s the second time it's broken down in a month.

‘shop till I drop’ means ...... .

A) enjoying shopping very much
B) getting very tired of shopping
C) hating shopping
D) shopping for a long time in a day
E) getting up early for shopping
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52757

Answer the question according to the paragraph.             

People used to go to work mostly on foot. Today, people prefer going to work by means of different kinds of transportation. There used to be slow trolley-buses in certain cities in the past. Today, there are fast cars.

There used to be a roundabout in almost every town. There are many junctions in big cities today. There used to be a lot of trees in cities in the past. There are high buildings in cities instead of trees. The buildings were used to be low in the past. There didn’t use to be many kinds of things to buy in the past. There are a lot of things to buy today.

Which option is true according to the text?

A) People used to use fast trolley-buses in the past.
B) The cars are faster today than they were in the past.
C) People use only fast cars to go to work today.
D) There were junctions in big cities in the past.
E) People go to work mostly on foot today.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14994

A DIFFICULT SHOPPING

Sally: Debra, I need your help.

Debra: Oh, what happened? Of course, I will help if I can.

Sally: I’m very confused. I can’t decide which jacket I should buy.

Debra: Oh Sally, this is so easy. OK, let me see.

Sally: Here they are. I like both of them very much. They are so attractive and beautiful.

Debra: Sure they are. They look very impressive. What about their prices? Which one is more expensive? Did you ask their prices?

Sally: Yeah. The black one is $75 and the grey one is $80. They are nearly the same price.

Debra: OK. What about asking the shop assistant for help? Maybe, we can make our mind much more easily. Excuse me! Can you help us?

Shop Assistant: Yes, sure. How can I help you?

Debra: What are these jackets made of?

Shop Assistant: Let me see. The grey one is made of artificial leather and the black one is made of leather.

Debra: Oh, perfect, thank you. Emma, I think you should buy the black one. The leather ones are usually of higher quality than the artificial ones.

Sally: Well, I know that very well. However, I can’t make up my mind. Should I try them on again?

Shop Assistant: Of course, as you wish.

Sally: Look at them again, Debra! Which one looks more beautiful?

Debra: The black one looks great on you. It’s longer than the grey one. You are tall and thin, so it fits you great. Without any doubt, you should buy the black one.

Shop Assistant: The black one is also on sale. It costs $75 as I said before. I also advise you to buy it. You won’t be regretful.

Sally: OK. I have made up my mind. I will buy it. Thanks a lot.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E
